description: glosso- +‎ -lalia, from Ancient Greek γλῶσσᾰ (glôssa, “tongue; language”) (ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *glōgʰs) + λᾰλῐᾱ́ (laliā́, “talking; form of speech, dialect”) (from λᾰ́λος (lálos, “talkative”) + -ῐ́ᾱ (-íā, “suffix forming feminine abstract nouns”)).

entries.meaning: Speaking a language one does not know, or speaking elaborate but apparently meaningless speech, while in a trance-like state (or, supposedly, under the influence of a deity or spirits); speaking in tongues.  [from late 19th c.]
examples: Synonyms: glossolaly, speaking in tongues, speaking with tongues

entries.meaning: Synonym of xenoglossy (“knowledge of a language one has never learned”).
